titles.title: Martin Van Buren National Historic Site Boundary Revision Act
Martin Van Buren National Historic Site Boundary Revision Act
A bill to revise the boundary of the Martin Van Buren National Historic Site, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on National Parks. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 110-599.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with amendments favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Bingaman with amendments. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 984.

bill.summary:
9/16/2008--Reported to Senate amended. Martin Van Buren National Historic Site Boundary Revision Act - Adjusts the boundary of the Martin Van Buren National Historic Site in the state of New York to include approximately 261 acres of land identified as the "PROPOSED PARK BOUNDARY" as depicted on the "Boundary Map, Martin Van Buren National Historic Site," dated January 2005.
Authorizes the Secretary to acquire such lands and interests from willing sellers. Requires land acquired for the Site to be administered as part of such site.
Authorizes appropriations.
